title: Trump vs Jim Acosta 主流傳媒大多不報的對答片段！美帝網民看後一面倒撐Trump！

replies.msg:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ix5NK5sDH1g

Jim: Mr. President. I challenge you on ... on one of the statments that you made in the end of campaign in midterm that ...

Trump: Here we go.

Jim: well if you know ... Mr. President, that this caravan was an invasion, as you know President, I consider caravan was not an invasion. It's a group of migrants
moving up from Central America towards the border with the US.

Trump: Thank you for that ...

Jim: Why did you characterize it as such?

Trump: I consider that an invasion. You and I have a difference of opinion.

Jim: Do you think you demonized immigrants in election and try, want to ...

Trump: No no no... I want them to come into the country but they have in legally

You know they have to come in , Jim, through a process. I want to be a process and I want people to come in and we need the people

Jim: Your campaign, your campaign...

Trump: Wait, wait! You need why we need the people, because we have hundreds of companies moving in. We need the people

Jim: Your campaign had an ad showing migrants climbing over walls and so...

Trump: It's true. They weren't actors. Well, no. It's true. Do you think they were actors? They weren't actors. They didn't come from Hollywood. These were... these were people. This was actual. You know it happened a few days ago and ...

Jim: They are hundreds of miles away... though they're hundreds and hundreds miles away. That's no an invasion

Trump: honestly, I think you should let me run the country and you run CNN. If you did it well, your ratings...

Jim: let me ask you a question. Are you worried...

Trump: That's enough. That's enough. That's enough.

Jim: May I ask on the Russia investigation. Are you concerned that you may have...

Trump: I am not concerned about anything with you

Jim: ... main investigation because it's a hoax. Are you...

Trump: That's enough. Put down the mic.

Jim: Mr. President...

How could anyone vote against this guy? These aren't reporters. To quote Jim Acosta: "As you know Mr President, the caravan was not an invasion." Does that sound like a question to anyone in the room? Do those sound like the words of an unbiased reporter interested in the facts?﻿
